Vulnerability.Title: shadow-utils bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The shadow-utils packages include programs for converting UNIX password files to the shadow password format, as well as utilities for managing user and group accounts. This update fixes the following bugs: Previously, running the "useradd -Z" command created a new SELinux login entry only after creating and populating the user home directory, but with incorrect SELinux contexts of the home directory files. To fix this bug, the SELinux login entry is now assigned to the newly created user before populating the home directory, and the SELinux contexts of the home directory files are now correct. (BZ#1077809) With the support for split groups, the newgrp command needs to exhaustively search all groups on a system for a given GID to see whether the user is a member of such a group. Due to this exhaustive search, the newgrp command took a lot of time to finish and caused high network traffic on systems pulling user and group information from a Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) server. With this update, if the user is a member of the group specified by the newgrp command, the exhaustive search is not performed, and executing newgrp consumes reasonable amount of time and network traffic. (BZ#1096275) Previously, the chage command handled date in format of " DD YYYY" incorrectly, as " DD hhmm". Consequently, if chage was used with such date specification, the date was set to an unexpected value. With this update, chage handles date in format of " DD YYYY" correctly, and the date is set to an expected value. (BZ#1103343) Users of shadow-utils are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
